static void setAdListener (FlurryAdListener listener)
 Set the FlurryAdListener for asynchronous ad serving. The FlurryAdListener is an interface which can be implemented to receive notification of various events associated with ads. If this method is called more than once, the previously set listener will be overridden, i.e. there can only be one listener.
static void setLocation (float lat, float lon)
 Set the default location. Useful when it is necessary to test ads from other countries or places, or if your app is location-aware and you do not wish the Flurry SDK to determine the user location via GPS.
static void clearLocation ()
 Clear the default location.
static void setCustomAdNetworkHandler (ICustomAdNetworkHandler handler)
 Sets the class which handles custom ad networking. Useful when creating an interface to third party network mediation.

 Clear the targeting keywords of the app.

Detailed Description

The Flurry Android Advertising SDK.

Deprecated:
We recommend using the new object-based APIs in com.flurry.android.ads unless you are creating an interface to third party network mediation using ICustomAdNetworkHandler.
Author:
2009-2014 Flurry, Inc. All Rights Reserved

Flurry For Publishers is the data-powered monetization platform that delivers targeted audience segments to your advertisers and networks. Powered by Flurry's enormous dataset with audience insights gathered from 700M devices, FFP enables you to maximize CPMs and fill rates across your iOS and Android applications.

See also:
Flurry Publisher Support Site for more information

3.0.0 Clear the targeting keywords of so that no keywords are trasnmitted when ads are requested.

Clear the UserCookies object.

Deprecated:
We recommend using the new object-based APIs in com.flurry.android.ads.
Since:
3.0.0 Clear the UserCookies object such that no UserCookies information will be transmitted with an ad click.
See also:
setUserCookies(Map< String, String >) for details on setting the UserCookies object.

static void enableTestAds ( boolean  test  )  [static]
Deprecated:
We recommend using the new object-based APIs in com.flurry.android.ads. Call to receive test ads from the Flurry server to ensure proper implementation. Test ads do not generate revenue and therefore MUST be disabled before submitting to the Market.
Parameters:
test 
static void fetchAd ( Context  context,
String  adSpace,
ViewGroup  viewGroup,
FlurryAdSize  size 
) [static]

Makes zero or one asynchronous ad requests and prepares an ad for display.

Deprecated:
We recommend using the new object-based APIs in com.flurry.android.ads.

In order to use this method correctly, you should implement FlurryAdListener. After an ad is successfully fetched and prepared, the SDK will call FlurryAdListener.spaceDidReceiveAd. Your implementation of this method should call FlurryAds.displayAd. public class Example extends Activity implements FlurryAdListener { FrameLayout mBanner; public void onCreate(Bundle bundle) { super.onCreate(bundle); setContentView(R.layout.example); mBanner = (FrameLayout)findViewById(R.id.banner); FlurryAds.setAdListener(this); } public void onStart() { super.onStart(); FlurryAgent.onStartSession(this, mApiKey); FlurryAds.fetchAd(this, mAdSpaceName, mBanner, FlurryAdSize.BANNER_BOTTOM); } public void spaceDidReceiveAd(String adSpace) { FlurryAds.displayAd(this, mAdSpaceName, mBanner); } }

Since:
3.0.9
Parameters:
context A reference to a Context object such as an Activity or an Service.
adSpace The placement of the ad within your app. For example, for a splash screen ad, it might be named "SPLASH_SCREEN"
size The default size of the adSpace. This can be overridden on the server. See FlurryAdSize for more details.
Returns:
void
static boolean getAd ( Context  context,
String  adSpace,
ViewGroup  viewGroup,
FlurryAdSize  size,
long  timeout 
) [static]

Request an ad from the Flurry ad server then render it. MUST be called from the main thread.

Deprecated:
We recommend using the asynchronous ad serving flow with fetchAd, displayAd and FlurryAdListener, instead of using this method.
Since:
3.0.0
Parameters:
context A reference to a Context object such as an Activity or an Service.
adSpace The placement of the ad within your app. For example, for a splash screen ad, it might be named "SPLASH_SCREEN"
viewGroup The ViewGroup into which the ad will be placed if the returned ad is a banner. In the case that the ad returned is a full screen ad, a Flurry built Activity will be launched which contains the ad, and the viewGroup that is passed in will be ignored. In most cases this should be an instance of RelativeLayout. If it's another subclass of ViewGroup, the alignment will be ignored, and the ad will be added to the ViewGroup with basic layout settings only.
size The default size of the adSpace. This can be overridden on the server. See FlurryAdSize for more details.
timeout The maximum amount of time to wait for the server to return a result. Set this to 0 to conduct this operation in the background.
Returns:
true if an ad was shown, or false otherwise
static void initializeAds ( Context  context  )  [static]

Request ads from the Flurry ad server for ad spaces with pre-caching enabled.

Deprecated:
initializeAds is now handled automatically.
Since:
3.0.0 Makes an asynchronous ad request to the Flurry ad server, which will respond with ads for ad spaces that have pre-caching enabled (in the ad space set up screen for your app). If you do not enable pre-caching for any ad spaces, there's no need to call this method.
See also:
http://support.flurry.com/index.php?title=Publisher/GettingStarted
Parameters:
context A reference to a Context object such as an Activity or an Service.
static boolean isAdAvailable ( Context  context,
String  adSpace,
FlurryAdSize  size,
long  timeout 
) [static]

Returns true if an ad is available from the Flurry ad server for the specified ad space.

Deprecated:
We recommend using the asynchronous ad serving flow with fetchAd, displayAd and FlurryAdListener, instead of using this method.
Since:
3.0.0
Parameters:
context A reference to a Context object such as an Activity or an Service.
adSpace The placement of the ad within your app. For example, for a splash screen ad, it might be named "SPLASH_SCREEN"
size The default size of the adSpace. This can be overridden on the server. See FlurryAdSize for more details.
timeout The maximum amount of time to wait for the server to return a result. Set this to 0 to check the cache and return immediately.
Returns:
true if ads are available to show, or false otherwise
static boolean isAdReady ( String  adSpace  )  [static]

Returns true if an ad has been fetched and prepared by a previous call to fetchAd.

Deprecated:
We recommend using the new object-based APIs in com.flurry.android.ads.
Since:
3.2.1
Parameters:
adSpace The placement of the ad within your app. For example, for a splash screen ad, it might be named "SPLASH_SCREEN"
Returns:
true if an ad has been prepared and calling displayAd would render an ad for this ad space.
static void removeAd ( Context  context,
String  adSpace,
ViewGroup  viewGroup 
) [static]

Remove the adSpace ad from the specified viewGroup If it is necessary to remove an ad from the view of the user, calling removeAd(context, adSpace, viewGroup) will remove the ad for the specified adSpace.

Deprecated:
We recommend using the new object-based APIs in com.flurry.android.ads.
Note:
The adSpace simply represents the placement of the ad in your app and should be unique for each placement. Only one ad will show at a time for any given ad space.
Parameters:
context A reference to a Context object such as an Activity or an Service.
adSpace The adSpace of the ad
viewGroup The ViewGroup which holds the ad
static void setAdListener ( FlurryAdListener  listener  )  [static]

Set the FlurryAdListener for asynchronous ad serving. The FlurryAdListener is an interface which can be implemented to receive notification of various events associated with ads. If this method is called more than once, the previously set listener will be overridden, i.e. there can only be one listener.

Deprecated:
We recommend using the new object-based APIs in com.flurry.android.ads.
See also:
FlurryAdListener and fetchAd for more details
Parameters:
listener Your implementation of FlurryAdListener
static void setLocation ( float  lat,
float  lon 
) [static]

Set the default location. Useful when it is necessary to test ads from other countries or places, or if your app is location-aware and you do not wish the Flurry SDK to determine the user location via GPS.

Deprecated:
We recommend using the new object-based APIs in com.flurry.android.ads.
Parameters:
lat The latitude
lon The longitude
static void setTargetingKeywords ( Map< String, String >  targetingKeywords  )  [static]

Set a Map<String,String> of key/value pairs to send to the Flurry servers when an ad is requested.

Deprecated:
We recommend using the new object-based APIs in com.flurry.android.ads.
Since:
3.0.0 Keywords allow the developer to specify information on a user executing an ad action for the purposes of targeting. There is one keywords object that is transmitted to the Flurry servers on each ad request. If corresponding keywords are matched on the ad server, a subset of targeted ads will be delivered. This allows partners to supply information they track internally, which is not available to Flurry's targeting system.
See also:
clearTargetingKeywords() for info on clearing the keywords.
This document for information on setting up keywords in your AppSpot campaign: http://support.flurry.com/index.php?title=Publisher/GettingStarted/v2 // From the main Activity of the app public void onStart() { FlurryAgent.onStartSession(this, myApiKey); // Create a Map of keywords Map<String, String> keywords = new HashMap<String, String>(); keywords.put("favoriteColor", getFavoriteColor()); FlurryAgent.setTargetingKeywords(keywords); }
Parameters:
targetingKeywords A Map<String,String> of key/value keywords
static void setUserCookies ( Map< String, String >  userCookies  )  [static]

Set a Map<String,String> of key/value pairs that will be transmitted to the Flurry servers when an ad is clicked.

Deprecated:
We recommend using the new object-based APIs in com.flurry.android.ads.
Since:
3.0.0 UserCookies allow the developer to specify information on a user executing an ad action. There is one UserCookie object, and on each ad click that UserCookie is transmitted to the Flurry servers. The UserCookie key/value pairs will be transmitted back to the developer via the app callback if one is set.
See also:
clearUserCookies() for clearing the user cookies // From the main Activity of the app public void onStart() { FlurryAgent.onStartSession(this, myApiKey); // Create a Map<String,String> to hold the user cookies Map<String, String> uCookies = new HashMap<String, String>(); uCookies.put("userId", getUserId()); FlurryAgent.setUserCookies(uCookies); }
Parameters:
userCookies
